entry.title: How the Universe Differs From Its Mirror Image
entry.summary: From living matter to molecules to elementary particles, the world is made of “chiral” objects that differ from their reflected forms. The post How the Universe Differs From Its Mirror Image first appeared on Quanta Magazine

entry.title: License Plate Reader Company Flock Is Building a Massive People Lookup Tool, Leak Shows
entry.summary: Flock, which has license plate readers (LPRs) all around the country, wants police to be able to “jump from LPR to person,” according to leaked audio obtained by 404 Media.

entry.title: Star Wars Shows the Future of AI Special Effects and It Sucks
entry.summary: Industrial Light & Magic revealed a short film showcasing how it wants to use generative AI for Star Wars and it’s completely embarrassing.

entry.summary: A killed man's AI avatar testifies in court; Meta is developing facial recognition for its smart glasses; and how AI is changing baseball.

entry.summary: Kanye’s Nazi song has been chased off of most mainstream platforms, but it’s all over Instagram.

entry.title: Unity Is Threatening to Revoke Licenses From DayZ Developer Dean Hall
entry.summary: Game developer RocketWerkz doesn’t understand why Unity is threatening to pull its licenses for its games.

entry.title: Introducing The Quanta Podcast
entry.summary: Exploring the distant universe, the insides of cells, the abstractions of math, the complexity of information itself and much more, The Quanta Podcast will be a tour of the frontier between the known and the unknown. entry.title: The Simulation Says the Orioles Should Be Good
entry.summary: AI, simulations, and technology have revolutionized not just how baseball is played and managed, but how we experience it, too.

entry.title: How Video Game Sex Scenes Are Made
entry.summary: Game developers use intimacy coordinators, velcro, and juicy oranges to make better sex in games.

entry.summary: The new site is a cozy and chaotic successor to 'Twitch plays Pokémon.

entry.title: New Bill Would Make All Pornography a Federal Crime in the U.S.

entry.title: Republicans Try to Cram Ban on AI Regulation Into Budget Reconciliation Bill
entry.summary: Republicans try to use the Budget Reconciliation bill to stop states from regulating AI entirely for 10 years.

entry.title: AI-Powered Coca-Cola Ad Celebrating Authors Gets Basic Facts Wrong
entry.summary: A new Coke ad proudly features a quote from a J.G. Ballard book, only he didn’t write the words and it’s not his book.

entry.title: Ancient Poems Record the Decline of a Special Porpoise
entry.summary: The Yangtze finless porpoise is near extinction in the wild, but glimpses of its heyday can be found in centuries of Chinese poetry.

entry.title: Man ‘Disappeared’ by ICE Was on El Salvador Flight Manifest, Hacked Data Shows
entry.summary: Ricardo Prada Vásquez was not on a government list of people sent to a mega prison in El Salvador. But hacked data shows he was booked on a flight to the country.

entry.title: Well, Well, Well: Meta to Add Facial Recognition To Glasses After All
entry.summary: Meta previously lost its shit at 404 Media when we reported that someone had paired facial recognition tech with the company's smart glasses. Now Meta is building the invasive technology itself.

entry.title: Are you more likely to die on your birthday?
entry.summary: Are you more likely to die on your birthday? Yes.

entry.title: The Molecular Bond That Helps Secure Your Memories

entry.summary: America’s roads are more dangerous than those of almost every country in the developed world. We know how to change that.
